thread.title: African-American chefs catered to presidents for 150 years | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: African-American chefs catered to presidents for 150 years | Daily Mail Online

author: Caroline Howe For Dailymail.Com
title: African-American chefs catered to presidents for 150 years | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad EXCLUSIVE - Bill Clinton loved jerk chicken, FDR craved sour pigs' feet and Barack Obama's fave was a blue-cheese burger with garlic aioli and Parmesan-sprinkled fries: How African-American chefs have catered to the presidents African Americans have run the White House kitchen as chefs, butlers, stewards and servers for every First Family for nearly one hundred and fifty years New book by author Adrian Miller dissects the social and political considerations that saw African-American contributions to the White House minimized Miller's 'group biography' tells tales from the presidential kitchen, including a list of presidents' favorite foods from George Washington to Barack Obama Black cooks first arrived at the White House with the first president who was responsible for paying for staff as well as underwriting entertaining costs First Lady Jackie Kennedy changed that precedent when she created the position of 'White House executive chef' in 1961 But President Johnson's beloved Texas black cook, Zephyr Wright, stepped in to make the president's homey southern cooking Published: 18:04 GMT, 20 February 2017 | Updated: 20:02 GMT, 20 February 2017 68 shares
